result.execSummary:
The defendant Alonzo Romelle Kimble-Hinton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court will not accept good faith efforts to complete any conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharges.
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court set restitution at zero.*
Maintain employment of at least 20 hours per week. If not employed at least 20 hours per week be enrolled in at least 9 credit hours of educational programming.
No contact with any Hollister store locations.
Court will authorize expungment upon successful completion of all conditions of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alonzo Romelle Kimble-Hinton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Filed, Justice Point Report dated 10/19/2015.

As to COUNT 1 as AMENDED-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court granted defense request for an adjourned sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Alonzo Romelle Kimble-Hinton in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State placed negotiations on the record. State filed an Amended Information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 1-- Theft by Fraud (Value Not Exceeding $2,500), contrary to sec. 943.20(1)(d) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a) Wis. Stats., a Class A Misdemeanor.

Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of the amended information and waived formal reading.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Alonzo Romelle Kimble-Hinton in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for status conference. Discussion regarding Justice Point reports and missed office contacts. Defense counsel requested a projected plea date. ADA Schoepp will be handling this matter for the State. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

After the case was called the clerk was notified by the Public Defender's Office that attorney Stewart no longer works at the PD's Office. Attorney Valeria Taylor will be handling this matter going forward. SPD will notify attorney Taylor of the next court date. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Alonzo Romelle Kimble-Hinton in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Attorney Stewart is not in court. Clerk made several attempts to contact defense counsel but was unsuccessful. Court ordered this matter be adjourned. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Status conference scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.

Defendant Alonzo Romelle Kimble-Hinton in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart who appeared by telephone.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of James W. Frisch for the State of Wisconsin.  Case recalled.  Justice Point notified the court that defendant tested positive for Oxycodone, with no prescription.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court ADMONISHED defendant and indicated that further positive tests for illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription would result in a change in bail.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and continued matter before Branch 25 on 8/24/15 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Alonzo Romelle Kimble-Hinton in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart, who appeared by telephone.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of James W. Frisch for the State of Wisconsin.  State indicated that ADA Frisch requested another plea and sentencing date, as he needs to speak with the victim(s) in this matter.  Defense counsel did not object.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and set matter before Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Alonzo Romelle Kimble-Hinton in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.    Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  All terms and conditions of bail continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Alonzo Romelle Kimble-Hinton in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Parties request another date; defendant has a similar case in Waukesha County and the parties will work to consolidate this case with Waukesha County or vice versa.  Court granted joint request for adjournment and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alonzo Romelle Kimble-Hinton in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Ronald Dague and James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/11/15.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Hollisters at 2500 N Mayfair Road

Defendant Alonzo Romelle Kimble-Hinton in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Alonzo Romelle Kimble-Hinton in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
